channel.title: ACTA Bill
channel.description:
My friend was talking on the phone today, and out of boredom, I began listening in on the convorsation, because it seemed to peak my interest. After hearing something about an act that would put copyright infringment to a complete hault, I had to know more. He told me to look up the ACTA bill when I got home, and I found this.
http://actaactionnow.org/index.html
According to this, the bill is designed to basically obliterate copyright infringement by granting warrantless searches to investigative organizations if they can assume that someone is infringing copyrights in any way.
The two things that caught my attention was...
When traveling between countries, they are allowed to search anything that can digitally store data for any copyrighted material that you cannot prove you legally obtained. They have the ability to demand any personal information from ISP's on customers they believe to be committing copyright infringiment, and can demand them to permanently terminate Internet connection from these consumers.
I'm not sure if this is bullshit and has no chance of happening, or if were all going to be fucked one day.
Read up and tell me what you think. (If any information I provided myself is incorrect based on the provided article, then don't listen to me. I'm just seeing what kind of information you can provide on this, and/or any comments on this bill. I gave the article knowing that I had already forgotten some of the things I just read so that I would not be persuading any false thoughts on this. The article is smarter than I am, I am just trying to spread the information.)

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

revengr:

I heard if this is put into effect, then Peer2Peer programs will be shut down, like LimeWire and uTorrent.

No, because Peer to Peer programs aren’t illegal. There are plenty of valid uses for torrents, such as distributing large files (like Linux distributions, games etc) quickly and efficiently.

[quote=“Old Rsc Player, post:6, topic:360161”]Just put your stored data somewhere on the internet and when you arrive in that country redownload it.

This seems pretty thought through, I’m not gonna lie.

item.title: ACTA Bill
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’ve known about this for a very long time from the EFF newsletter:
https://www.eff.org/search?text=ACTA

Good news is it has just been dealt a huge blow in Europe:

Electronic Frontier Foundation – 9 Sep 10

European Parliament Asks EU ACTA Negotiators to Protect Citizens' Fundamental...

In a victory for democracy and transparency, the European Parliament adopted Written Declaration 12/2010 (WD 12) on the proposed Anti-Counterfeiting Trade Agreement earlier this week. WD 12 calls on EU negotiators to ensure that ACTA does not weaken...

Hopefully other places follow suit.
